title: Fundamentals of Catalyst Design and Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: General Chemistry and Basic Mathematics Knowledge
context.additional_context: Hands-on worksheet-based instruction with smartphone-assisted data analysis activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain three key physicochemical parameters (temperature, phosphorus content, composition-weighted electronegativity) affecting catalyst performance.
Learners can predict the performance of ternary catalyst systems by applying simplified catalyst design rules.
Learners can complete a project proposing optimization directions through pattern recognition in given experimental data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
